alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Hunterdon, Mercer, and Somerset. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Somerville, Bensalem, Bridgewater, Ewing, Princeton, Manville, Bristol, and Doylestown. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 341 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 15 and 40. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 8 and 34. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 344 and 345...and between mile markers 347 and 351. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 59 and 76. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 16 and 26. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
